body_html:
@Utumno Would Dataset.flat_map() work for this? For example, if you have a dataset of variable-length tensors called var_len_dataset, you can get all the slices as follows:

var_len_dataset = ...  # Element shape (?, x, y, z)
all_slices = var_len_dataset.flat_map(
    lambda x: tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices(x))  # Element shape (x, y, z)
body_text:
@Utumno Would Dataset.flat_map() work for this? For example, if you have a dataset of variable-length tensors called var_len_dataset, you can get all the slices as follows:
var_len_dataset = ...  # Element shape (?, x, y, z)
all_slices = var_len_dataset.flat_map(
    lambda x: tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices(x))  # Element shape (x, y, z)
body:
@Utumno Would `Dataset.flat_map()` work for this? For example, if you have a dataset of variable-length tensors called `var_len_dataset`, you can get all the slices as follows:

```python
var_len_dataset = ...  # Element shape (?, x, y, z)
all_slices = var_len_dataset.flat_map(
    lambda x: tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices(x))  # Element shape (x, y, z)
```
